title: Dual-Stack Migrations: How to Move Petabytes Without Losing Sleep
partialText: Real-world archive migrations arenâ€™t about a single cutoverâ€”they require 2â€“2.5 years of dual-stack overlap. Run old and new systems in parallel, track metrics on separate telemetry stacks, maintain independent alert planes, budget 25â€“40% extra capacity, plan for peak power/cooling, and rehearse rollback drills. The goal: 90 days of stable ingest, verified parity, and zero P1 incidents.

title: 5 Data Pipeline Anti-Patterns That Silently Wreck Your Stack (And How I Fixed Them)
partialText: Most pipelines donâ€™t fail overnightâ€”they decay through shortcuts. This guide breaks down five destructive anti-patterns: monolithic DAGs, no schema contracts, non-idempotent writes, poor observability, and hardcoded configs. Each section includes real-world fixesâ€”from partition overwrites to schema validation and metrics-driven monitoringâ€”so you can design pipelines that fail safely, recover fast, and stop triggering 3AM alerts.

title: The Skeleton Modifier 3D: Its Design, Plus More
partialText: In Godot 4.3 we are adding a new node called 'SkeletonModifier3D' It is used to animate bones outside of `AnimationMixer' We have also deprecated some of the pose override functionality in `Skeleton3D` This means that if you want to develop a custom skeleton you will need to modify the bones within that method.

title: How to Excel in AI Without Learning to Code
partialText: Thriving at an AI company doesnâ€™t require coding skillsâ€”it requires AI literacy. Master core concepts like LLMs, RAG, and tokens, connect them to your specific role, and build real intuition by using the tools. The real competitive edge isnâ€™t writing Python; itâ€™s understanding what the code does and translating that into business value.

title: CTF Walkthrough: Exploiting Cookie-Based Privilege Escalation in Power Cookie
partialText: In picoCTFâ€™s â€œPower Cookieâ€ challenge, a website relies on a client-side isAdmin cookie to determine user privileges. By changing its value from 0 to 1, users can escalate access and retrieve the flagâ€”highlighting why authentication and authorization must always be validated on the server, not trusted to browser-stored data.

title: Algorithmic Ventriloquism: How Crustafarian Agentic AI Bots Will (Not) Take Over the World
partialText: Moltbook is a â€œsocial network for AIâ€ where bots interact. In January 2026, one AI created Crustafarianism, a full-fledged religion with scriptures, prophecies, and adepts. This isnâ€™t evidence of conscious AI: itâ€™s algorithmic ventriloquism, humans projecting agency onto bots. The real concern is security, since Moltbook agents can access user systems, enabling prompt-injection risks.

title: How to Build Social Media Strategy For a Deep Tech Startup
partialText: NVIDIA spent decades engineering for a future no one else saw. Stripe is simply solving a problem of creating a billion-dollar company. OpenAI â€œroad can go somewhere either great or terrifying, and OpenAI will need epic sums to steer it toward the right destination,â€ and Shopify is living "a few years in front of everyone else to know what's coming. All great companies have great stories behind them, while unicorn stories sound good and inspiring, early-stage founders can turn storytelling into a great tool to build strong investor relations, engage early adopters, secure enterprise pilots, and attract the creme de la creme of the talent pool. Creator economy has proven to us - social media re here to help. In this guide, I will address how early-stage deeptech startups can build a reliable social media strategy to support startups on their rocky road to Dublin.

title: Multilingual Prompt Injection Exposes Gaps in LLM Safety Nets
partialText: Multilingual Prompt Injection is a technique that exploits language gaps in security systems. Safety nets being created are mostly in English and fails when non-English language exploits are activated

title: Astounding Stories of Super-Science, February, 2026- Table of Links
partialText: Astounding Stories of Super-Science (February 2026) is a classic pulp science fiction publication now available in the public domain. Part of HackerNoonâ€™s Book Blog series, this digital edition revives vintage speculative storytelling for modern readers. Originally released via Project Gutenberg (eBook #77931), itâ€™s free to read, share, and explore as part of sci-fi history.

title: Stripeâ€™s x402 Turned Bitcoinâ€™s Micropayments Dream Into a Bot Economy
partialText: Stripe's x402 integration lets AI agents autonomously pay for services using USDC on Baseâ€”solving the micropayment problem Bitcoin promised but never delivered. Except the beneficiaries aren't humans; they're autonomous software buying API access, data feeds, and compute resources. Crypto spent fifteen years promising financial sovereignty for people and delivered a better payment rail for machines.

title: Did OpenAIâ€™s Pentagon Deal Influence the Retirement of GPT-4o?
partialText: Three recent moves â€” OpenAIâ€™s deployment of ChatGPT to GenAI.mil, the retirement of GPT-4o, and tighter GPT-5.2 restrictions â€” have fueled concern among researchers and developers who argue that safety-driven constraints are limiting deep intellectual exploration. The article explores whether these decisions reflect a broader strategic shift toward institutional alignment at the expense of user freedom and creative depth.

title: Will Crypto Survive the Quantum Computing Era?
partialText: Quantum computing is often linked to broken passwords, cracked codes, and collapsing digital security. If fully developed, itâ€™d threaten the existence of cryptocurrencies and many other systems as well. Quantum mechanics describes the behavior of matter and light.

title: LLM-as-a-Judge: How to Build an Automated Evaluation Pipeline You Can Trust
partialText: LLM-as-a-Judge uses one language model to evaluate another, enabling scalable, criteria-based scoring of LLM outputs. This guide explains the method, its common biases, and walks through a complete LangChain and Claude example for production-ready monitoring.

title: EU Orders Apple, Meta to Open iOS and Messaging to Competitors
partialText: The Digital Markets Act (DMA) has joined the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) The act, which entered into effect in May 2023, introduces new compliance requirements on â€œgatekeepers,â€ defined as large digital platforms providing core platform services. Non-compliance can result in serious penalties, with the European Commission fines Apple and Meta â‚¬500 million and â‚¬200 million, respectively, in April 2025.

title: Go's Cryptography Packages Were Audited: The Results
partialText: Go ships with a full suite of cryptography packages in the standard library to help developers build secure applications. Google recently contracted the independent security firm [Trail of Bits] to complete an audit of the core set of packages. The audit produced a single low-severity finding, in the legacy and unsupported [Go+BoringCrypto integration], and a handful of informational findings.

title: Website Blocking Gone Too Far: Homework and Censored Suicide Prevention Sites Were Also Blocked
partialText: School districts all over the country, like Rockwood in the western suburbs of St. Louis, go much further, limiting not only what images students can see but what words they can read.

title: The 7-Layer Blueprint for Serving, Securing, and Observing AI Agents at Scale
partialText: As Generative AI shifts from simple retrieval to autonomous action, enterprises face the engineering challenge of scaling scattered proofs of concept into robust, secure systems. This article deconstructs the architecture of a production-grade AI Agent Platform, positioning it as an internal Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) that supports both code-first engineers and low-code integrators. By breaking the system down into seven logical containersâ€”Interaction, Development, Core, Foundation, Information, Observability, and Trustâ€”the guide outlines a blueprint for a "factory" capable of serving, securing, and monitoring a fleet of agents that deliver tangible business ROI.

title: Workflow Utility Spotlight: Fast Impulse Response Handling for Spatial Audio
AOrchestra Turns AI Agents Into On-Demand Specialists (Not Static Roles)
partialText: AOrchestra treats agents as recipesâ€”Instruction, Context, Tools, Modelâ€”so an orchestrator can spawn the right sub-agent at runtime and cut waste.
